newsitem.title: NETHERLANDS: ARA fuel oil bunkers flat, rest of Europe dips.
newsitem.headline: ARA fuel oil bunkers flat, rest of Europe dips.

text.p: ARA bunkers were little changed on Thursday while other European bunkers mostly dipped in a thin day of trading, dealers said.
Rotterdam 380 CST was quoted at around $98/100 fob after little change in the barge market.
A couple of large enquiries emerged. Both were won by majors who offered aggressively. Suppliers said the deals were clinched at $98. Independent traders, by contrast, were left with few crumbs.
Some said bunker suppliers were reluctant to quote numbers in the face of fierce competition from majors.

Hamburg prices dipped in response to the now becalmed Rotterdam market. On Wednesday, German suppliers said they had priced themselves out of the market. Prices fell $2 a tonne to $99/$101 fob on Thursday, but business barely improved.
Mediterranean prices were mostly softer, French and Spanish fuel oil bunkers dipping by $2 a tonne. However, Italian prices were slightly more expensive, resulting in a modest rise in enquiries.
